repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: nvim_win_set_config cannot move floating windows to different tab pages
Solution: Add cross-tab window movement logic with proper insertion point handling 

Fix #33790 

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.body:
Autocommands may do a number of things here which can break this:

- Close `win`, making `win` invalid.
- Close `parent`, making `parent` invalid. (`parent` isn't used later, but it's best to bail in that case)
- Move `win` to a different tabpage via `nvim_win_set_config` or close its tabpage, leaving `win_tp` out-of-date.
- Move `parent` to a different tabpage via `nvim_win_set_config` or close its tabpage, leaving `parent_tp` out-of-date.
  (These previous two points are why `win_tp` and `parent_tp` are re-assigned again later for splits after the `win_goto` stuff)
- Turn `win` into a non-float, breaking the later assumptions that it's still a float.

If these checks fail you should also make an attempt to restore the old `curwin`, like is done for splits.

Not sure what this is checking. Why would `parent_tp->tp_curwin` be NULL here?

You _should_ however check that `win_tp->tp_curwin` is set to something valid if it was previously equal to `win`, like is done for splits.
cool update for validate
This shouldn't ever return NULL, it'd be a bug as it'd imply `firstwin` is also NULL...
Why would `parent` be NULL here?

A lot of these checks are redundant.
For example, if `win_tp` is NULL, then `win` was closed. If its tabpage was closed, then `win` would've also been closed.

Check out what is done for splits for inspiration.
Unmarking as resolved; doesn't seem to have been addressed. Still not sure what is being checked here.
oops right
I dunno if this is correct. Someone else ought to check.

you mean `w_hl_needs_update`?   when I move to the current tab, if I don't set it, the background of the floating window doesn't update correctly.  not sure if I need to update when w_viewport_invalid is set.
I will clean up some redundant logic later.

Mostly the grid/compositor stuff, as I'm unfamiliar with it.

> if I don't set it, the background of the floating window doesn't update correctly

Yeah I also can't say for sure why that happens. Probably best to wait for a second opinion. :+1:
Btw I forgot a closing `}` in the suggestion. (That's what I get for typing the changes directly in the text box :zany_face:)
np
From glancing at this, doesn't look like `curwin_moving_tp` is ever set when moving a float? (Add a test for this too)
missing set it before win_goto..

```
        // If `win` was the curwin of its old tabpage, select a new curwin for it.
        if (win_tp->tp_curwin == win) {
          win_tp->tp_curwin = win_float_find_altwin(win, win_tp);
        }
```
there may not correct ? I got a crash with this test

```lua
    it('sets curwin_moving_tp when moving float between tabs fails #test', function()
      local buf = api.nvim_create_buf(false, true)
      local float_win = api.nvim_open_win(buf, true, {
        relative = 'editor',
        row = 1,
        col = 1,
        width = 10,
        height = 5
      })
      command('tabnew')
      local tab2_win = api.nvim_get_current_win()
      command('tabprev')
      api.nvim_set_current_win(float_win)
      command('autocmd WinLeave * call nvim_win_close('..tab2_win..', true)')

      eq('', pcall_err(api.nvim_win_set_config, float_win, {
        relative = 'win',
        win = tab2_win,
        row = 0,
        col = 0,
        width = 10,
        height = 5
      }))

      eq(float_win, api.nvim_get_current_win())
    end)
    
    Assertion failed: (tp != curtab), function win_float_find_altwin, file winfloat.c, line 369.
AddressSanitizer:DEADLYSIGNAL
=================================================================
==52902==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: ABRT on unknown address 0x0001963425b0 (pc 0x0001963425b0 bp 0x00016d609010 sp 0x00016d608ff0 T0)
    #0 0x0001963425b0 in pthread_kill+0x8 (libsystem_kernel.dylib:arm64+0x95b0)
    #1 0x000196282804 in abort+0x78 (libsystem_c.dylib:arm64+0x79804)
    #2 0x000196281a38 in assert_rtn+0x118 (libsystem_c.dylib:arm64+0x78a38)
    #3 0x00010422ecdc in win_float_find_altwin winfloat.c:369
    #4 0x0001029d19f4 in nvim_win_set_config win_config.c:698
    #5 0x000102946868 in handle_nvim_win_set_config dispatch_wrappers.generated.h:10035
    #6 0x0001036770cc in request_event channel.c:364
    #7 0x000103cbb43c in state_handle_k_event state.c:118
    #8 0x0001036f6dd8 in nv_event normal.c:6644
    #9 0x0001036b9a50 in normal_execute normal.c:1245
    #10 0x000103cbb184 in state_enter state.c:100
    #11 0x000103698ca4 in normal_enter normal.c:522
    #12 0x0001033c4890 in main main.c:655
```

Assertion tells you the issue: we have to specify `tp` as `NULL` when referring to `curtab`. We can instead skip setting `tp_curwin` for `curtab` anyway, so the condition should be `if (win_tp != curtab && win_tp->tp_curwin == win)` instead.

Also there needs to be a return before `restore_curwin:`; we don't want the curwin to be restored in the happy path.
okay

comment_regular_data.body: cleaned up some redundant logic and reorganized the implementation

title: fix(api): support floating window movement between tab pages
